results.definition: travelling about without any clear destination
examples: she followed him in his wanderings and looked after him

results.definition: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: The gypsies roamed the woods
roving vagabonds
the wandering Jew
The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

results.definition: be sexually unfaithful to one's partner in marriage
examples: She cheats on her husband
Might her husband be wandering?

results.definition: go via an indirect route or at no set pace
examples: After dinner, we wandered into town

results.definition: to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course
examples: the river winds through the hills
the path meanders through the vineyards
sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body

results.definition: lose clarity or turn aside especially from the main subject of attention or course of argument in writing, thinking, or speaking
examples: She always digresses when telling a story
her mind wanders
Don't digress when you give a lecture
a restless mobile society
the nomadic habits of the Bedouins
believed the profession of a peregrine typist would have a happy future
wandering tribes
meandering streams
rambling forest paths
the river followed its wandering course
a winding country road
an erratic comet
his life followed a wandering course
a planetary vagabond
